ENTRY:5218
HEAD:zōng₁ 宗
MC:Middle Chinese: tsuoŋ 
LH:Later Han: tsouŋ 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *tsûŋ
GLOSS:"Ancestral temple, ancestral, lineage" (which performs ancestor worship),
GLOSS:"royal clan; to venerate, honor" [OB, BI, Shi].
	[T] Sin Sukchu SR tsuŋ (平)
	[T] MGZY dzung (平) [tsuŋ]
	[T] ONW tsɑuŋ
	[E] ST: WT rdzoŋ(s) ``castle, fortress'' as administrative center, WB (ə-)cʰoŋ ``a building''. A Chinese temple is conceived and designed as an abode for deities or ancestors, from a simple structure to a palace (L. Thompson 1996: 60). “To govern the [zōng ``lineage temple''] was to govern the town” (Chang K.C. 1976: 70).
::WB	cʰoŋ	``a building''
>:WT rdzoŋ ``castle, fortress'' as administrative center
>:WB cʰoŋ ``a building''. A Chinese temple is conceived and designed as an abode for deities or ancestors, from a simple structure to a palace . “To govern the  was to govern the town”

MC:Middle Chinese: dzuo 
LH:Later Han: dzɑ 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *dzâ
GLOSS:"To go, go away, march" 徂 [Shi] >
GLOSS:"to pass away, die" 殂 [BI, Shu]; a Han period dialect word for
GLOSS:"to marry" (of a woman) in Qí [FY 1, 14].
	[<] ? endopass. of a root *tsa ({§4.6}), perhaps lit. ``to get to be gone''.

ENTRY:5245
HEAD:zuān 鑽
MC:Middle Chinese: tsuân 
LH:Later Han: tsuɑn ~ tson 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *tsôn
GLOSS:"To bore, perforate" [Zhuang] >
GLOSS:"penetrate" [Lunyu].
	[WFE] ST: PTB *tsow ``thorn'' (STC no. 276; HST: 46) > Chepang cuʔ, Bodo suʔ (Weidert 1987: 26); Mikir arsō < r-sō ``sharpen'' ⪤ iŋsō < m-sō ``cutting edge'', WB chuᴮ ``thorn'' ⪤ cuᴮ ``prick, pierce'' < PLB *tsu². WT mtsʰon ``any pointed or cutting instrument''.
	[C] The word {zuò₅,záo 鑿} (dzâk) ``to bore, chisel out'' may be related.
::WT	mtsʰon	``any pointed or cutting instrument''

ENTRY:5247

::WT	mtsʰul-pa	``lower part of face, muzzle, beak''

ENTRY:5249
HEAD:zuì₁ 醉
MC:Middle Chinese: tswiᶜ 
LH:Later Han: tsus (tsuis) 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *tsuts
	[T] ONW tsui
GLOSS:"Drunk" [Shi].
	[E] MK *[cʔ]uc, *[cʔ]uuc ``drunk, intoxicated''  (Shorto 2006 #796) (MK c = OC ts).
	[WFE] TB: WB cut ``suck, imbibe, absorbe''.
	[C] The exact interrelationship between the two OC words, MK and TB is not clear, unless one assumes here fragments of an areal wf. Furthermore, the OC may belong to the same root as {cuì 淬} ``dip into'' because of the common notion that one ``soaks'' in vices, note {yín₃ 淫}; cuì 啐 and 淬 may be the same word.
::WB	cut	``suck, imbibe, absorbe''
>:MK *uc, *uuc ``drunk, intoxicated''

OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *tshûts
GLOSS:"To taste, drink" 啐 [Liji].

ENTRY:5251
HEAD:zuì₂ 最
	{jù₇} 聚

ENTRY:5252
HEAD:zuì₃ 罪
MC:Middle Chinese: dzuậiᴮ 
LH:Later Han: dzuəiᴮ 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *dzûiʔ
	[T] ONW dzuɑi
GLOSS:"Crime, offense, guilt" [BI, Shi].
GLOSS-NOTE:The original graph for zuì  lookes similar to huáng 皇 so that Qín Shǐ Huángdì 秦始皇帝 replaced it with 罪 which was the original graph for
GLOSS:"fish trap" [SW] (Wáng Lì 1982: 406); the element fēi 非 is therefore not phonetic. The etymology is not clear, unless it is a ST word cognate to Lushai sualᴿ
GLOSS:"bad, wicked, evil, wrong, to misbehave, sin" ⪤ sualᴴ ``to rape'' (a woman).

	[T] ONW tson

ENTRY:5255
HEAD:zuó 昨
MC:Middle Chinese: dzâk 
LH:Later Han: dzɑk 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *dzâk

GLOSS-NOTE:Sagart (1999: 67, 160) relates zuó to {xī₆ 昔} (sjäk)
GLOSS:"previously, yesterday", among others.
	[T] Sin Sukchu SR dzaw (入), LR dzawʔ
	[T] MGZY tsaw (入) [dzaw]

ENTRY:5256
HEAD:zuǒ 左
MC:Middle Chinese: tsâᴮ 
LH:Later Han: tsɑiᴮ 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *tsâiʔ
GLOSS:"Left (side)" [BI, Shi] > (``consider or treat as left'' =
GLOSS:"unfavorable" >)
GLOSS:"not approve, to oppose" [OB] (Takashima EC 5, 1979-80: 54), ``disagree'' xiāng-zuǒ 相左 [Zuo]; ``crooked'' (road) [Hanshu].
	[T] Sin Sukchu SR tsɔ (上), LR tsɔ
	[T] MGZY dzo (上) [tsɔ]
	[T] ONW tsɑ
	[D] Y-Guǎngzhōu ³⁵tsɔᴮ¹, K-Méixiàn tsɔᴮ
	[N] For the meanings, see comments under {yòu₂ 右}. The OB graph is a drawing of the left hand of oneself, from one's own perspective, just as {yòu₂ 右} ``right'' (side) shows the right hand in this fashion, to which {kǒu 口} ``mouth'' (= ``phonetic loan'') was later added to distinguish it from {yòu₁ 又} which was commonly used to write ``and, further- more''.
	Since ``mouth'' was already used for ``right'', another mark had to be found for the graphic differentiation of ``left'', but the choice of {gōng₁ 工} ``work'' has occasioned much speculation.
	[E] <> This word also occurs in PTai *zaiᶜ² ``left''.
::PTai	*zaiᶜ²	``left''
>:This word also occurs in PTai *zaiᶜ² ``left''

ENTRY:5257
HEAD:zuǒ 左 ⪤ zuǒ 左佐
MC:Middle Chinese: tsâᶜ 
LH:Later Han: tsɑiᶜ 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *tsâih
GLOSS:"To help, assist, aid" (< be to one's (left) side) [BI, Shi].
GLOSS-NOTE:The semantics are the mirror image of {yòu₂ 右}.

ENTRY:5258
HEAD:zuò₁ 佐
	{zuǒ} 左

ENTRY:5259
HEAD:zuò₂ 坐
MC:Middle Chinese: dzuâᴮ 
LH:Later Han: dzuɑiᴮ ~ dzoiᴮ 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *dzôiʔ
GLOSS:"To sit" [Shi].
	[T] Sin Sukchu SR dzwɔ (上)
	[T] MGZY tswo (上) [dzwɔ]
	[T] ONW dzuɑ
	[D] PMin *dzoiᴮ
	[WFE] Bodman (1980: 134) compares zuò to WT sdod-pa ``to sit'', but this raises many phono- logical difficulties (for the initials, see {§5.7}). This word is shared with PKS *dzuːi⁶ ``to sit''.
::PKS	*dzuːi⁶	``to sit''

ENTRY:5260
HEAD:zuò₂ 坐 ⪤ zuò 坐

LH:Later Han: dzuɑiᶜ ~ dzoiᶜ 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *dzôih
GLOSS:"Seat" [Zuo] (Downer 1959: 275).
	[<] exopass. derivation ({§4.4}), lit. ``what is sat on''.

ENTRY:5261
HEAD:zuò₃ 作
MC:Middle Chinese: tsâk 
LH:Later Han: tsɑk 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *tsâk
GLOSS:"To get up" (in the morning) [Lunyu] >
GLOSS:"to start, start work" [Shu],
GLOSS:"to sprout" [Shi] > ``to do, perform, work, set up, build'' [OB, BI, Shi] > ``act as, be'' [Shu]; intr. ``to be active'' [Shi].
GLOSS-NOTE:Some OB forms of the graph suggest a hand, palm facing up, holding a small plant or stick.
	Also other words meaning ``do, make'' develop the meaning ``function as, act as, to be'', see {wéi₃ 為}, {yì₆ 役}.
	[T] Sin Sukchu SR tsaw (入), tsɔ (去), tsu (去), PR tsɔ, LR tsawʔ
	[T] MGZY dzaw (入) [tsaw], dzu (去) [tsu]
	[WFE] This etymon may perhaps be related to WT mdzad-pa ``to do, act'', Kukish ca, Mru caŋ ``to do, make'' (Löffler 1966: 140), yet there are phonological and semantic difficulties, therefore the TB items are more likely related to {sī₁ 司}.
::Mru	caŋ	``to do, make''

LH:Later Han: tsʰɑᶜ 
OCM:Minimal Old Chinese: *tshâkh
GLOSS:"To establish" [Yi],
GLOSS:"to place" [Lunyu],
GLOSS:"lay aside, cease" [Li].

ENTRY:5263
HEAD:zuò₄ 飵
	{jǔ₁} 咀

ENTRY:5265
HEAD:zuò₅,záo 鑿 ⪤ zào 鑿
MC:Middle Chinese: dzâuᶜ 
LH:Later Han: dzɑuᶜ
GLOSS:"A hole" [Zhouli] (Downer 1959: 275).
	[<] exopass. of zuò, záo 鑿 *dzâuk ({§4.4}), lit. ``what has been bored''.
	[C] An allofam is prob. {zuān 鑽} ``to bore''. Note also OKhmer coḥ /coh/ ``to bore, pierce'' (⇒ Tai: S. /cɔ̀q/ ``to make a hole'' [Jenner / Pou 1982: 67]); this may possibly be an area etymon.
